meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flaccid.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noted the flaccidity of the patient's muscles.
meanings.sent2: The flaccidity of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent3: The flaccidity of the overcooked pasta was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The flaccidity of the deflated tire was a stark reminder of the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The flaccidity of the old rubber band made it snap easily.

meanings.sent1: She avoided the flaccidity of the soggy bread.
meanings.sent2: The flaccidity of the worn-out mattress made it uncomfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent3: The flaccidity of the overcooked vegetables was disappointing.
meanings.sent4: His argument lacked strength and was filled with flaccidity.
meanings.sent5: The flaccidity of the wilted flowers saddened her.

meanings.sent1: The team's performance showed signs of flaccidity.
meanings.sent2: Her voice sounded full of flaccidity during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The flaccidity of the lazy cat lying in the sun was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The flaccidity of the party made it clear it was time to leave.
meanings.sent5: His flaccidity in completing the task disappointed his boss.
